intro: Bubonium daltonii subsp. vogelii, commonly known as the Vogel's bubonium, is a rare and endemic plant species found in specific regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid conditions. Its flowers are usually small and yellow, with a distinctive structure that aids in pollination by insects. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
